production_grade_target.definition: Production-grade means the platform can fully replace the current ML tooling stack with deterministic, auditable, secure, and operable workflows.
acceptance_criteria: Entire ML lifecycle runs within a single Project without manual external stitching
Any run is reproducible from dataset + commit SHA + environment
All actions are audited and exportable
SSO and RBAC function end-to-end
Installation and upgrades are documented and automatable
No implicit state or hidden dependencies exist
HA control plane, observability, and backup/DR are validated

phases.name: Architecture Baseline
phases.goal: Establish control/data plane separation and Kubernetes baseline with explicit system boundaries.
scope: Control Plane vs Data Plane separation
No user code execution in Control Plane
Kubernetes baseline (single-cluster, multi-cluster readiness, air-gapped readiness)
deliverables: Architecture decision records for plane separation
Runtime boundary enforcement for user execution
Cluster topology support matrix and air-gapped install notes
Project isolation model (no hidden cross-project dependencies)
acceptance_criteria: Control Plane never executes user code
Kubernetes baseline documented and validated
Project boundaries enforced by design

work_items.title: Control/data plane separation ADR
work_items.notes: Documents control-plane vs data-plane boundaries and no user code in control plane.

work_items.title: Runtime execution guardrail
work_items.notes: Execution code isolated; depguard rule prevents control plane imports.

work_items.title: Depguard control-plane boundary
work_items.notes: Depguard denies runtimeexec imports from control plane packages.

work_items.title: Kubernetes baseline notes
work_items.notes: Documents single-cluster, multi-cluster readiness, and air-gapped notes.

work_items.title: README cleanup for docs
work_items.notes: Removes stale open/ references and points to docs/.

artifacts.description: Control vs data plane separation and no user code in control plane.
Kubernetes deployment baseline and air-gapped notes.
Depguard rule enforcing control plane boundary.

phases.name: Core Domain Model and Metadata
phases.goal: Implement immutable core entities and metadata persistence.
deliverables: Immutable write paths and append-only audit log
acceptance_criteria: All core entities persist with immutable guarantees
Audit events are append-only and exportable
Artifacts stored in object storage with lifecycle policies

phases.name: Execution and Orchestration
phases.goal: Deliver deterministic run execution with pipeline orchestration.
deliverables: Environment definition artifacts and lock files
Deterministic run execution tied to dataset + commit SHA + environment
acceptance_criteria: Any run reproducible from dataset + commit SHA + environment
Retry/backoff behavior documented and idempotent
Pipeline dependencies enforced

phases.name: Data and Model Governance
phases.goal: Provide dataset/model registries, lineage, and quality rules.
scope: Policy enforcement on datasets and models
deliverables: Dataset registry API and UI/CLI support
Quality rule definitions and evaluation records
Lineage capture for datasets, runs, models
acceptance_criteria: Dataset versions are immutable with schema and lineage
Model promotions follow defined workflow
Lineage is queryable and exportable

phases.name: Developer Toolchain Surface
scope: Remote IDE access (VS Code/JetBrains via SSH/HTTP)
acceptance_criteria: Developers can run notebooks, terminals, and remote IDEs
Environment templates are selectable and reproducible

phases.name: Integrations Matrix
scope: Git/SCM integration with commit SHA enforcement
Container registry integration with image digest binding
deliverables: Vault-like secret retrieval with no UI exposure
acceptance_criteria: Production runs enforce commit SHA
All required webhook events emitted
SSO and role mapping function end-to-end
Secrets never shown in UI or logs

phases.name: Security and Audit
phases.goal: Enforce zero-trust security, RBAC, and mandatory audit.
scope: Session TTL, forced logout, session limits
RBAC for Project, Dataset, Run, Model
Retention, secure deletion, legal hold hooks
deliverables: RBAC policy engine with resource-level enforcement
acceptance_criteria: All state-changing actions audited and non-disableable
RBAC enforced at Project and resource levels
Retention and secure deletion policies enforced

phases.name: Operational Readiness
scope: Helm/Kustomize deploy, upgrades/rollbacks, external DB support
acceptance_criteria: Control Plane is HA with documented SLOs
Backup/restore procedures validated
Air-gapped installation documented

phases.name: Quality Gates and Acceptance
phases.goal: Ensure CI/CD quality and final acceptance criteria.
scope: Lint, unit, integration, and E2E tests
End-to-end flow: git -> run -> artifacts -> model promotion
deliverables: Security scanning reports and SBOM artifacts
Acceptance test suite and sign-off checklist
acceptance_criteria: All acceptance criteria satisfied
End-to-end workflow passes in CI
Security scans and SBOM generation are automated

implementation.notes: Started P0 baseline: ADRs, runtimeexec guardrails, object store interface, and Kubernetes baseline notes.
